Use R to solve the following problems.

#### Problem 1

<center>
![](p1.png){width=350px}   
</center>

```{r}
f <- function(x){
  f <- .075 * x + .2
  f[(x< 3) | (x >5)] = 0
  return(f)
}
curve(f, 2, 6, n=1000)
curve_area <- ( f(5) + f(3) )
cat("area under the curve should add to one. f(5) plus f(3) is: \n")
cat(curve_area)
```
```{r}
install.packages('pracma') 
library(pracma)
cat("Compare P(X < 4) with P( X <= 4 )\n")
cat("P(X <= 4): ")
#cat(.075/2*16+.2*4-.075/2*9-.2*3)
integral(f,0,4)
cat("\nBoth are equal because in continuous distribution probability on any point is zero.")
```
```{r}
cat("P(3.5 <= X <= 4.5): ")
#cat(.075/2*(4.5^2)+.2*4.5-.075/2*(3.5^2)-.2*3.5)
integral(f,3.5,4.5)
```
```{r}
cat("P(4.5 < X): ")
#cat(.075/2*(5^2)+.2*5-.075/2*(4.5^2)-.2*4.5)
integral(f,4.5,5)
```


#### Problem 2

<center>
![](p2.png){width=340px}   
</center>

```{r}
e <- exp(1)
q <- function(x){
  q <- (x/4)+log(4/x, base = e)*x/4
  q[(x< 0)] = 0
  q[(x >4)] = 1
  return(q)
}
cat("What is P(X<1): ")
#integral(q,0,1)
variable1 <- 1/4+log(4/1)*1/4
cat(variable1)
cat("\n What is P(1<=X<=3): ")
#integral(q,1,3)
cat(3/4+log(4/3)*3/4 - variable1)
```


#### Problem 3

Assume that an adult female is randomly selected. Females have pulse rates
that are normally distributed with a mean of 74.0 beats per minute and a
standard deviation of 12.5 beats per minute (based on Data Set 1 “Body
Data” in Appendix B).

* Find the probability of a pulse rate less than 100 beats per minute.

```{r}
lessthan_100 <- pnorm(100,74,12.5)
cat("the probability of a pulse rate less than 100 beats per minute: \n")
cat(lessthan_100)
```


* Find the probability of a pulse rate greater than 80 beats per minute.

```{r}
greaterthan_80 <- 1-pnorm(80,74,12.5)
cat("the probability of a pulse rate greater than 80 beats per minute: \n")
cat(greaterthan_80)
```


* Find the probability of a pulse rate between 60 beats per minute and 70
beats per minute.

```{r}
between60_70 <- pnorm(70,74,12.5) - pnorm(60,74,12.5)
cat("Pulse rate between 60 and 70 beats per minute: \n")
cat(between60_70)
```


* Find the probability of a pulse rate between 70 beats per minute and 90 beats
per minute.

```{r}
between70_90 <- pnorm(90,74,12.5) - pnorm(70,74,12.5)
cat("Pulse rate between 70 and 90 beats per minute: \n")
cat(between70_90)
```


* Find $P_{90},$ which is the pulse rate separating the bottom 90% from the top 10%.

```{r}
p90 <- 1.28*12.5+74
cat("P90 is: ")
cat(p90)
```


* Find the first quartile Q1, which is the pulse rate separating the bottom 25%
from the top 75%.

```{r}
cat("The first quartile seperating the pulse rate is: \n")
qnorm(.25,74,12.5)
```
